summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of an entity named "Belmont." The documents primarily concern FBI investigations, CIA liaison activities, and surveillance of individuals such as John Roselli and Gabriel Mannarino, along with inquiries from the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC). They cover topics ranging from gambling activities to potential CIA overreach and interactions with the FBI, as well as investigations into anti-Castro groups and the Fair Play for Cuba Committee. The documents span from 1961 to 1975, focusing on intelligence activities and investigations during that period.
